name: v1.25.0
body:
## What's Changed
* Document the least required vCenter permissions for CPV by @HanFa https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/636
* Add missing logic to pass RemoteAuth when constructing NSX-T Config by @lubronzhan  https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/589
* Clean up and refactor the logic for CCM entrypoint by @HanFa https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/639
* CredentialsManager accepts alternate Secret format by @tylerschultz https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/641
* Try not to delete VM when vm is inaccessible for any reason, but VM is still present in the VC inventory by @lubronzhan https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/650
* expose new flag `is-legacy-paravirtual` to indicate whether the paravirtual mode is legacy or not by @lubronzhan https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/653
* Bump golang version in go.mod to go 1.19 by @lobziik https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/659
* Change the node selector to affinity rule by @lubronzhan https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/663

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/compare/v1.24.0...v1.25.0

name: vsphere-cpi-chart-1.25.0
body: A Helm chart for vSphere Cloud Provider Interface Manager (CPI)

name: v1.24.2
body:
## What's Changed Since 1.24.1
* Cherry pick  Add new legacy flag to indicate whether it's legacy paravirtual mode (https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/653)
* Cherry pick c heck for vm state using mof when VM can't be found by using uuid (https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/650)


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/compare/v1.23.1...v1.24.2

name: v1.23.2
body:
## What's Changed
* [Cherrypick 1.23] Formatted code (https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/644)
* [Cherrypick 1.23] Do not restart the CPI pod on the config file's Chmod events (https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/624)
* [Cherrypick 1.23] Add new legacy flag to indicate whether it's legacy paravirtual mode (https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/653) 
* [Cherrypick 1.23] Check for vm state using mof when VM can't be found by using uuid (https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/650)


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/compare/v1.23.0...v1.23.2

name: vsphere-cpi-chart-1.24.2
body: A Helm chart for vSphere Cloud Provider Interface Manager (CPI)

name: v1.24.0
body:
## What's Changed
* Add changes in 1.23 to master branch by @lubronzhan in https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/634
* Cut CPI version for 1.24 Kubernetes. by @HanFa in https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/635

## New Contributors
* @lobziik made their first contribution in https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/560
* @dotalchemy made their first contribution in https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/566
* @KennethStebbins made their first contribution in https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/594
* @srm09 made their first contribution in https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/582

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/compare/v1.23.1...v1.24.0

name: v1.23.0
body:
v1.23.0
## Changelog since v1.23.0-alpha.1 

- Update cluster/node selector labels for paravirutal https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/618

## Version Compatibility

Supports Kubernetes clusters on v1.23.X with [allowed version skew](https://kubernetes.io/docs/setup/release/version-skew-policy/#kube-controller-manager-kube-scheduler-and-cloud-controller-manager).

name: v1.22.6
body:
# v1.22.6
## Changelog since v1.22.X:
Return error when VM's info returned from VC doesn't contains IP address (https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/586)
Fix logic to correctly read and pass along value `nsxt.RemoteAuth` in config (https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/591)

## Changelog since v1.21.X:
* Add v1.20 and v1.21 manifests (https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/487)
* Migrate the helm chart to /charts repo and update related docs (https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/478)
* Bump Kubernetes dependencies to v1.22.X and go to 1.16 (https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/496)

## Version Compatibility

Supports Kubernetes clusters on v1.22.X with [allowed version skew](https://kubernetes.io/docs/setup/release/version-skew-policy/#kube-controller-manager-kube-scheduler-and-cloud-controller-manager).

name: v1.21.3
body:
# v1.21.3
## Changelog since v1.21.0:
Backport https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/607:
* Return error when VM's info returned from VC doesn't contains IP address 
* For paravirtual, empty ProviderUUID appears for node 
* Remove cached node based on UUID when unregister node 
* Do not use the cached node addresses when NodeAddresses is invoked. 

## Changelog since v1.20.X:
* Add initial support for NSX-T routable pods in vSphere paravirtual cloud provider:
  * Add IPPool and RouteSet APIs (https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/464 & https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/466)
  * Introduce node and ippool controllers to do node ipam (https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/469)
  * Implement Route interface (https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/468)
* Bump Kubernetes dependencies to v1.21.X

## Version Compatibility

Supports Kubernetes clusters on v1.21.X with [allowed version skew](https://kubernetes.io/docs/setup/release/version-skew-policy/#kube-controller-manager-kube-scheduler-and-cloud-controller-manager).

name: v1.20.1
body:
# v1.20.1

## Changelog since v1.20.0: https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/610
Backport https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/607:
* Return error when VM's info returned from VC doesn't contains IP address 
* For paravirtual, empty ProviderUUID appears for node 
* Remove cached node based on UUID when unregister node 
* Do not use the cached node addresses when NodeAddresses is invoked. 


## Changelog since v1.19.X:
* Introduce initial support for vSphere paravirtual cloud provider
* Update Kubernetes dependencies to v1.20.X
* Fix a bug where only the first VM NIC was checked for node addresses (https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/461)

## Version Compatibility

Supports Kubernetes clusters on v1.20.X with [allowed version skew](https://kubernetes.io/docs/setup/release/version-skew-policy/#kube-controller-manager-kube-scheduler-and-cloud-controller-manager).

## Changelog since v1.22.X:
- Bump Kubernetes dependencies to v1.23.X and go to 1.17 (https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/558)
- `internal-network-subnet-cidr` and `external-network-subnet-cidr` config variables accept a list of comma separated CIDRs (https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/524)

## Version Compatibility

name: v1.22.4
body:
# v1.22.4
## Changelog since v1.22.X:
Update doc to point to 1.22.4 (https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/548)
Cherry pick several bug fixes(https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/543)
including:
- Do not use the cached node addresses when NodeAddresses is invoked.(https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/541)
- Clean up nodeUUIDMap and nodeNameMap based on node uuid when node is deleted (https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/540)
- Show vsphere-cloud-controller-manager version in the log correctly https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/535

## Changelog since v1.21.X:
* Add v1.20 and v1.21 manifests (https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/487)
* Migrate the helm chart to /charts repo and update related docs (https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/478)
* Bump Kubernetes dependencies to v1.22.X and go to 1.16 (https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/496)

## Version Compatibility

Supports Kubernetes clusters on v1.22.X with [allowed version skew](https://kubernetes.io/docs/setup/release/version-skew-policy/#kube-controller-manager-kube-scheduler-and-cloud-controller-manager).

* Support dualstack node IP discovery (https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/508)

name: v1.21.1
body:
# v1.21.1
## Changelog since v1.21.0:
* Add doc to deploy k3c (https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/488)
* Fix panic issue when deploying k3c (https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/486)
* Fix helm doc (https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/494 https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/492 https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/491 https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/478)
* Fix CSI related doc (https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/500 )
* Exclude cilium from cni LIST (https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/499)
* Fix out of tree and intree link (https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/481)

## Changelog since v1.20.X:
* Add initial support for NSX-T routable pods in vSphere paravirtual cloud provider:
  * Add IPPool and RouteSet APIs (https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/464 & https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/466)
  * Introduce node and ippool controllers to do node ipam (https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/469)
  * Implement Route interface (https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/468)
* Bump Kubernetes dependencies to v1.21.X

## Version Compatibility

Supports Kubernetes clusters on v1.21.X with [allowed version skew](https://kubernetes.io/docs/setup/release/version-skew-policy/#kube-controller-manager-kube-scheduler-and-cloud-controller-manager).

name: v1.18.0
body:
# v1.18.0

## Changelog since v1.2.1:
* Bump k8s.io/kubernetes depedency to v1.18.12
  - adds new zone/region topology labels `topology.kubernetes.io/zone` and `topology.kubernetes.io/region`.
  - adds new instance type labels `node.kubernetes.io/instance-type`. 
* Enable dual-stack node addresses behind an alpha feature gate `ENABLE_ALPHA_DUAL_STACK` 
* Initial support for NSX-T routable pods

## Version Compatibility

Supports Kubernetes clusters on v1.18.X with [allowed version skew](https://kubernetes.io/docs/setup/release/version-skew-policy/#kube-controller-manager-kube-scheduler-and-cloud-controller-manager).

  - adds new instance type labels `node.kubernetes.io/instance-type`. 
* Enable dual-stack node addresses behind an alpha feature gate `ENABLE_ALPHA_DUAL_STACK` 
* Initial support for NSX-T routable pods

## Version Compatibility

# v1.18.0-alpha.0

Changelog since v1.2.1:
* Bump k8s.io/kubernetes depedency to v1.18.6
  - adds new zone/region topology labels `topology.kubernetes.io/zone` and `topology.kubernetes.io/region`.
  - adds new instance type labels `node.kubernetes.io/instance-type`. 
* Enable dual-stack node addresses behind an alpha feature gate `ENABLE_ALPHA_DUAL_STACK`

Supports Kubernetes clusters on v1.18.X

name: Cloud Provider vSphere v1.2.1
body:
This is the v1.2.1 release of the vSphere Cloud Provider

Changelog since v1.2.0:
* Fix a bug when discovering a VM's address by it's subnet or VM network name (https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/378)
* Fix a bug where a node may be prematurely deleted if vmtools is slow to report it's hostname (https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/387)

name: Cloud Provider vSphere v1.2.0
body:
This is the v1.2.0 release of Cloud Provider vSphere

Changelog since v1.2.0-rc.1:
- [BUG] instances: return InstanceNotFound error in InstanceID. PR: https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/365

Changelog since v1.1.0:
- [NEW] Support for NSX-T based Load Balancers PR: https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/292
- [NEW] Initial implementation for YAML based config. PR: https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/305
- [NEW] Update CPI image to use non-root account. PR: https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/297
- [NEW] Add support for Resource Pool and Folder traversal for Zones/Regions. PR: https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/362
- [ENHANCE] InstanceExistsByProviderID Signal Deletion to K8s. PR: https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/359
- [ENHANCE] Update docs for VMTools exclude-nics filtering. PR: https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/349
- [ENHANCE] Added guide on how to install CSI on an already-existing K8s cluster. PR: https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/293
- [ENHANCE] Documentation updates. PR: https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/310, 
- [BUG] Don't cache instances if addresses are not found. PR: https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/336
- [BUG] vSphere cloud-controller-manager should tolerate not-ready taint. PR: https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/339
- [BUG] Prevent guest from getting cached when unable to get properties. PR: https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/343
- [BUG] Remove ToLower when using FQDN. PR: https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/352
- [BUG] Log does not print node initialization success when zone labels are not configured. PR: https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/361

name: Cloud Provider vSphere v1.2.0 rc1
body:
This is the v1.2.0 rc1 release of Cloud Provider vSphere

Changelog since v1.1.0:
- [NEW] Support for NSX-T based Load Balancers PR: https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/292
- [NEW] Initial implementation for YAML based config. PR: https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/305
- [NEW] Update CPI image to use non-root account. PR: https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/297
- [NEW] Add support for Resource Pool and Folder traversal for Zones/Regions. PR: https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/362
- [ENHANCE] InstanceExistsByProviderID Signal Deletion to K8s. PR: https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/359
- [ENAHNCE] Update docs for VMTools exclude-nics filtering. PR: https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/349
- [ENHANCE] Added guide on how to install CSI on an already-existing K8s cluster. PR: https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/293
- [ENAHNCE] Documentation updates. PR: https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/310, 
- [BUG] Don't cache instances if addresses are not found. PR: https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/336
- [BUG] vSphere cloud-controller-manager should tolerate not-ready taint. PR: https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/339
- [BUG] Prevent guest from getting cached when unable to get properties. PR: https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/343
- [BUG] Remove ToLower when using FQDN. PR: https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/352
- [BUG] Log does not print node initialization success when zone labels are not configured. PR: https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/361

name: Cloud Provider vSphere v1.1.0
body:
This is the *Stable/GA* release of Cloud Provider vSphere

Changelog since v1.0.0:
- [NEW] Added functionality to allow setting the ExternalIP and InteralIP on k8s status.Address by applying filters based on both the VM Network Name and subnet. PR: https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/271, https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/284
- [NEW] Support for `[VirtualCenter]` to each have their own k8s secret to store vCenter creds. PR https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/241
- [NEW] Support for vCenter role-based access in `[VirtualCenter]`. This is the beginnings to allow multi-tenancy within a given vCenter which restricts access based on vCenter roles/rbac. https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/241
- [NEW] Added support for deploying vSphere CPI via Helm (https://github.com/helm/charts/tree/master/stable/vsphere-cpi). Documentation for how to setup Helm and deploy the vSphere CPI chart. https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/280
- [ENHANCE] Improvements in CI/CD including but not limited to staticcheck, update to docker images, etc. PRs: https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/242, https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/257, https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/274
- [ENHANCE] Documentation updates relating to zones and regions. PR: https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/251 
- [ENHANCE] Documentation around firewall considerations. PR: https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/269
- [ENHANCE] Document the minimum supported vSphere version (min: 6.7u3). PR: https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/263
- [BUG] Various bug fixes. PRs: https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/244, https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/248, https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/250, https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/253, https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/273, https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/282, https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/283
- [BUG] Various documentation fixes. PRs: https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/249, https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/254, https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/256, https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/264, https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/267, https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-vsphere/pull/286

name: Cloud Provider vSphere v1.0.0
body:
This is the *Stable/GA* release of Cloud Provider vSphere

Changelog since v0.2.1:
- Various improvements to CI related features including but not limited to: markdown, lint, etc
- Several documentation improvements
- Initial support for IPv6
- Removes CSI components into a separate repo: https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/vsphere-csi-driver
- Various bug fixes

name: Cloud Provider vSphere v0.2.1
body:
This is a *beta* release of Cloud Provider vSphere

Notable changes since v0.2.0:
- Implements InstanceShutdownByProvider interface
- Allows for zone lookups at the host level
- Various bug fixes

name: Cloud Provider vSphere v0.2.0
body:
This is a *beta* release of Cloud Provider vSphere

Notable features implemented:
- Initial advertised release in the form of *beta* for the CCM
- Implements CI and project health related features including but not limited to: pushing docker images to gcr, image creation based on tag creation, e2e testing, unit tests in the form of go tests, vet/fmt/lint checks, etc
- Initial release of the vSphere First Class Disk (FCD) based CSI driver. Implements block and file-level support.
- Implements zones support for CCM
- Implements support for multi-VC and multi-DC based configurations
- Establish project structure for CCM involving a refactor of pkg/common, pkg/cloud-provider/vsphere, and pkg/csi
- Experimental support for gRPC endpoint to expose VMs within a k8s cluster (disabled by default)
